column1: short of a length, gets an inside edge to the pad on the attempted flick
too full on the pads, clipped away to deep midwicket
short of a length, angled across, opens the face and gets beaten
length ball, punched to extra cover
dipping yorker, slanted across, swings and misses
length outside off, loads of room for Devcich who frees up and thumps it over long-on
full, angled across, crunched to cover
punched to cover
full, drifts away and too far across
length around off, drilled to cover
short of a length, slower and angled just enough across the left-hander to beat the outside egde
that's huge. Belted out of here. Offers him loads of width outside off and all Devcich needs to do turn around and shovel this over deep midwicket

that's awful from Zaman. Hasan angles this into his middle and off-stump. Lands it just short of a length and Zaman blindly swings looking for a big heave. Gets tucked up for room and beaten as the ball goes over the stumps
blocked towards mid-off
Hasan drops it short again but this time it's angled into off-stump, Zaman swivels and pulls to deep backward square leg
back-of-the-hand slower ball, fullish outside off, Zaman opens the face and steers to point

one shot too many from Zaman who has clearly learned nothing from his previous error. No room again and he tries to cart this back of a length delivery over the leg side but the ball curves in, kisses the inside edge and smashes into off-stump
that's a brute first-up to McCullum. Short, dead straight and accurate around middle, McCullum gets completely squared up and just about manages to drag his head out of the way

Devcich skies this one but it drops short of the two fielders giving it a chase at long-on. Drags this from well outside off and does not find the middle. Sameem at long-on gets down after the ball bounces and gets a hand but he has made contact with the boundary
blocked to the off side
stays legside of this wide yorker and makes no contact
short of a length, backs away and opens the face to point
again drags one from outside off. This is a repeat of the first delivery of the over, just that he's made a lot better connection and sends it soaring over deep midwicket

dropped. Umaid almost pulls off a stunner. Sends down a full toss that comes at an awkward height. Devcich awkwardly tries to pull it away and skews it up off the top-edge. Umaid darts back, gets right underneath and gets a hand, too, but it pops out as he drops down and the hand hits the turf hard
throws hard hands and mistimes this to cover
angled into middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
that's huge. Steps down the track to a short of a length delivery and gives himself enough room to flay this well over long-on. An 88-meter six
gets a glove as he tries to flick a back of a length delivery into the leg side
attempts a back-of-the-hand legcutter, slips out of the hand and goes slips away outside off
brilliant save at cover. Hafeez flings himself to his right to stop this hard slap. Absolutely thumped by Devcich. Had four written all over

bad shot selection again. Like Zaman, McCullum tries to pull with zero room. Gul angles in a short of a length delivery to middle and leg, and the ball sneaks below the swinging blade and crashes into the stumps
back of a length, angled in at leg, tries to flick and gets an inside edge to the pad
jumps back and flicks this shortish one in front of mid-on
length, slanted across, swing and a miss
back of a length, keeps a little low, flicked to mid-on for a quick one
full, angled in at the pads, and look at the timing on that one. Picked up off the pads for a flick over backward square leg
short, wide, chops a cut in front of deep point
slides across a length ball outside off, gets down to reverse sweep but it's the wrong length and he makes no contact
shortish, backs away and flays this to deep extra cover
back of a length, sliding in with the arm, finds the inside edge to midwicket as plays off the front foot
full, driven to wide long-off
front leg out of the way as he gets down on the back knee and slogs a length ball from outside off over deep midwicket. Ugly but effective. Right off the middle

dropped?. Nah, just couldn't get to it, it seems. Reverse sweep from Devcich, not full enough, and he knocks it in the air as a result. Short third man dives to the right and sticks out the right hand but can't get there. Would have been an outstanding catch
length ball, uses the angle to flick to midwicket
fullish outside off, hammers it back and ricochets off the bowler's boot towards long-off. They take the single and the fielder runs in and throws. Direct hit was needed
length, angling in, turned away to fine leg
low, dipping full toss outside off, driven to deep extra cover
length outside off, opens the face and runs it down to third man
flicked to deep midwicket
short of a length around middle, backs away and slaps through cover
big slog sweep from Salman. Clean strike. And in the slot too. Fullish length, on middle and leg, down on one knee and carts it outta here
cuts this from outside off to point
swings at one from outside off. Doesn't curve in as much as he expected it to and the ball trickles to fine leg off the inside edge
short outside off, chops a cut to point
short of a length, opens the face and pummels to point
fullish around off, driven back
back of a length, walks across and tries to flick and gets hit on the pad. Ah, was that close? They didn't really appeal. Nah, would have probably missed leg
pulls off the bottom edge to short fine leg where Dawson misfields. Sloppy from him but Hasan darts across a mile and flies across to put in a dive and pull it back at the boundary
back of a length, opens the face and steers to backward point
slower full one, dips outside off and gets past the bat as he brings it down
full on the stumps, Salman chips it straight over between long-on and long-off
full, backs away and drills it away through backward point with an open bat face
short, wide, gets on top and slaps it over point. Third man runs across and sticks the right hand out but it's well over him
length ball outside off, flicked to deep midwicket
short of a length, makes room and taps to point. Fifty for Devcich
dipping fuller one, clipped to long-on
short of a length, flicked to deep midwicket
full and dipping on leg, tries to flick and the ball goes off the pads to midwicket instead
flicked to midwicket
fullish and dipping, whipped away to wide long-on
short, slants away, pokes at it but gets beaten by the sharp drift

good high catch at long leg. Wahab with a shortish delivery. Salman is too close to it and miscues a pull off the toe end of the bat. Dawson runs forward and settles under it in the deep. Didn't entirely get underneath it so had to put in a dive in the end to complete it. But well-done
flighted outside off, Devcich comes down the track and swings big but doesn't get to the pitch and gets a leading edge that pops away to third man
now that's a clean strike. Lots of flight again and he stays inside the crease this time and slogs it away over deep midwicket
Dawson overcompensates with this length and drops this short. Devcich frees up his arms and slaps it over the long-off fielder jumping up at the boundary
short of a length, punched off the backfoot to long-off
goes for another slog and can't get underneath it entirely. Skewed off the inside part of the bat to the region between deep midwicket and long-on
full down leg, misses the flick and hits the pad. Appeal for lbw turned down as it's missing
short, wide, tries to cut and makes no contact
full outside off, drilled to long-on
full, makes use of the room to punch it to wide long-off
comes down the track and the bowler drags the length back, clumsily pulls it away off the top of the bat
yorker on the fourth or fifth-stump channel, carved away to short third man with an open bat face

dropped. Devcich has been put down and how costly will that prove? Devcich steps down the track and ends up getting too far away from the line. And it's slower as well and he mistimes his swipe off the outside of the bat to third man where two fielders run towards it. Sameen Gul gets to it in the end and spills
makes room and flays to sweeper cover
full, angling in, stays legside and swipes and misses as the ball gets away between bat and legstump

in the air again and this time it's taken. Length ball on the stumps, slower, tries to slog after clearing the front leg. Gets a top-edge and Hafeez at short fine leg calls for the catch and takes it. It was the keeper's but Hafeez calls for it and takes it
back of a length and outside off, chopped away to the right of the keeper
skids in on middle stump, hangs back and punches to long-on
back of a length on off, jabbed back to the bowler
on a length and outside off, pushed into the covers
shorter and outside off, swatted down to long-on off the back foot
dragged from outside off to deep midwicket with a slog-sweep
back of a length and spins away outside off, Sohail stays leg-side of the ball and fiercely flat-bats it through extra cover. Fetch that
Gulraiz dashes down the track. This is hurled short and wide outside off, past his reach
very full and sliding into the pads, picked up and handsomely flicked over backward square leg
full and angling into a push to deep midwicket
back of a length on off, camps back and whips to deep midwicket
length ball, angling, Gulraiz aims a biiig leg-side swipe but only squirts an inside edge onto the body
full on middle stump, Sohail shuffles across off and swings it hiiiiigh into the air. Finds enough distance too and clears deep midwicket
low full-toss on middle, bunted down to long-off
back of a length and skipping away outside off, beating the batsman's attempt to run it down to third man
tapped to the right of deep third man
back of a length and angling across off, employs the latest of late cuts and runs it down with the angle fine of deep third man
Gulraiz backs away, and swings and misses this short ball angling away
shuffles across off, but this back of a length ball beats his scoop
shorter and outside off, Gulraiz arches his back, uses the angle, and ramps it all the way for a six over third man
too short, uses the angle into him and swivels to dispatch it over deep midwicket with a six. Slower but picked early
yorker on off, dug out
full toss, pummeled down to long-on

poor cricket all around. Sadaf squeezes out this extremely full delivery to cover and Akhtar takes off for a run though Sadaf isn't interested at all. He is three-quarters the pitch down and has to make it back. Hasan runs across to cover and had forever to take aim and throw and he misses and they eventually take the single anyway. Horrific
slower length ball, slogged to cow corner
wide yorker, can't put bat to ball
walks across early but Wahab gets this one to dip late again outside off as Sadaf misses
full, carved away to sweeper cover
full and wide outside off, backs away and slices behind point for four
another dipping fuller one, this one jags away slightly as well, Akhtar can't put bat to ball
ah, throws water all over the good work and  sprays this on leg stump. Akhtar clips it away through the open spaces at cover
starts off with a seam-up. It's shortish and sliding in and he backs away and slashes a cut to point
harmless length ball outside off, backs away to give himself room and carts it over long-off with a clean swing of the arms
gets down to sweep the wrong length and misses, off the pad to short fine leg
that's some tripe. These are nothing deliveries. Curves in from well outside off and holds its line and he sees the room and punches off the backfoot through the gap at cover
now he sprays it down the leg side. Well down. No control at all on his lines and lengths
is that also a wide? Yes, it is. Overcompensates with the line and takes it too far outside off

gets duly punished for the extra ball. A short one with ample width and Kamran Akmal slaps it through backward point. A highlights package of an over to kick off the chase. Twenty off it. Safe to assume, perhaps, that we won't be seeing Devcich again in this game. At least not anytime soon
yes, he can. Wicket first ball for Abbot. This is his only appearance in this year's tournament. A short of a length delivery that's been chopped on as Wessels tries to pull with minimal room
full, sprayed down the leg side
fullish on middle and off, blocked off the front foot
shortish, just outside off, can't find the middle of the bat as he slashes and skews it back towards the bowler off the inside of the bat
tucked off the pads to deep square leg
low full toss, clipped off the pads to square leg
short, cutting in, tucked to midwicket. Good comeback from Lahore after the first-over blitz.
length on off, punched crisply to cover

leg before appeal, turned down. McCullum asks for the review after McClenaghan asks for it. Full, gets past the flick and strikes the pad. Pitching outside leg. That was evident even to the naked eye. A strange review. Nowhere close to leg-stump line
short of a length on middle and off, pulled to midwicket
full on off, caresses straight down the ground and beats McCullum to his right at long-off
length ball, punched in front of mid-on for a very quick single
full on middle, clipped to midwicket
short of a length outside off, too much width from Abbott, and Akmal punishes him with a backfoot punch through point
same line, same length, Akmal plays it slightly later this time and it's closer to point as a result. The fielder dives to his right but to no avail
length ball on middle and off, much better, blocked into the off side
back of a length on off, punched to cover
short of a length on off, defended to point
short, wide, punched to point
shortish, angled across, tries to pull but it's too close to him and he misses

oh, my! That's been thumped. Kamran Akmal deserves a Grammy for getting out of the way. Full outside off, and Smith shovels it with brute force straight down. Akmal manages to get out of the line efficiently
short of a length, flicked away to deep backward square leg with the angle
wide down the leg side. Sprayed a long way down
short, wide, slapped with extreme power in front of point
slower cutter, steered to point
slower length ball, opens the face to square third man
these are shoddy lines to anyone, let alone Kamran Akmal in this form. Full on leg stump, clipped off the pads to deep fine leg
fullish length ball, punched to mid-off
short of a length on off, carved away to sweeper cover
full, angling in on middle, clipped away to deep midwicket
shortish around off, pulled to midwicket
length on middle and leg, defended to mid-on
slider down leg, gets down to sweep and perhaps just about gets a glove. Seemed to have missed everything initially
waits before punching this to the off side
Yasir Shah, you beauty! What a delivery! A quick, skiddy slider on middle, drawing Smith forward and beating the inside edge and brushing the pad before taking out the stumps
full outside off, driven to long-off
short, pulls with zero room and drags it awkwardly to the left of deep midwicket
another slider, this one's fuller and is kept out down the pitch
short of a length on off, blocked
not short enough as he bottom-edges this pull to deep midwicket
short of a length, squares him up at pace - 143ks - and beats the outside edge
fullish length, hammered to mid-off
short of length, angled in, turned away to the left of the keeper
short, swivels and pulls to deep backward square off the inside of the bat
glorious shot from Kamran. Short but not wide enough. No problem, he manufactures some of his own and dissects the field with precision. Cut between backward point and short third man
length on middle, shifts back and knocks it back to the bowler
floats it up outside off, driven to deep extra cover
comes down the track and tries to heave, trickles towards midwicket off the inside of the bat
short on middle and off, rocks back and pulls through midwicket
short of a length, turning away slightly, waits and opens the face to third man. Pulled back just in front of the ropes by Abbott
turning in on middle and leg, clipped behind square
fullish length, defended off the front foot
fuller, comes on with the arm and goes off the outside of the bat as he plays through cover
shifts back dangerously to one that spins in. Bounces extra to catch him off-guard and he manages to pat it down to the off side
shifts back and punches through cover
short, not much turn, flashes and misses
pitched right up around off and Hafeez senses the opportunity to free his arms. Gets down on one knee and slog sweeps it over midwicket
advances, meets the pitch, gets right underneath and shovels it to the right of long-off
shortish, backs away and cuts to point
advances to a length ball and punches to long-off
short, backs away and cuts to point
spinning in on leg, flicked to the on side
advances to a slightly short of a length delivery and muscles it over midwicket
comes down the track and slugs this length ball over long-off. Another fifty for Akmal, his fourth this season. What a tournament he's had
that's outta here. Biggest hit of the evening. Way too full and Akmal gets down and slog-sweeps it over deep midwicket. Miles in the air and way back into the stands
full and sliding on leg-stump, helped along to deep fine leg
flicked with the turn to short fine leg
short, wide, slapped to sweeper cover
length ball, knocked back to the right of the bowler
length on middle and leg, turned away to fine leg
short, gets a little big on him but Akmal goes through with the pull nonetheless and beats deep fine leg running to his left
short and wide, slapped to sweeper cover
back of a length, opens the face and runs it down to third man
short, advances and pulls between long-on and deep midwicket, both converge and the former slides and stops it
short, bounces considerably and he pulls off the top part of the bat. But that was a mighty swing and it's cleared deep backward square leg by miles
length, backs away and whips to wide long-on. Kamran limps through for the single. Still struggling
short and wide, gets on top of it and deposits it over backward point
short of a length on off, flicked to between deep midwicket and long-on
swipes at a length ball from outside off and muscles it to deep midwicket
too short from young Shaheen and Akmal teaches him a lesson. Mighty pull over deep midwicket
length ball on middle and off, Hafeez fancies a run after Akmal taps to cover but is sent back
short, thinks of hooking it but is forced to scamper under it due to the pace and bounce
back of a length, tries to flick but is undone by the slower pace
full, wide, slower, no effort to get close to it as he swings and misses

miles, miles in the air. Shaheen calls for it and doesn't get a hand. Extremely tough chance. He had to run to his right. But ends up over-running and then arches back with reverse-cupped hands to make up for it
sixth six for Akmal, and it comes with the favoured slog sweep. Thumped well into the stands at deep midwicket
Yasir now slides one into Akmal's middle and leg stumps and Akmal charges down before carting him straight over long-on. Moves to 95
short and wide, cut to point
dropped. Should have been taken, really. Short and not turning away much, Akmal pulls to deep midwicket where McClenaghan dives forward but it keeps slightly low and he spills it

some respite for Lahore, even if it's the wicket of the less dangerous batsman. Hafeez backs away to cut but it's too close and not quite short. Inside-edges as it keeps a little low and loses his stumps
flicked towards midwicket and Yasir runs across to pick it up. Kamran refuses the single
full on off, driven in front of mid-off and Akmal makes a dash for it like his life depended on it
full, driven to the right of sweeper. 150 comes up
short of a length, angling in, turns around and helps it along to deep fine leg
shortish, mistimes a pull to wide long-on

is that the hundred? Yes, it is. Second PSL century for him. Two out of the three in PSL history now belong to him. This was ripe to get the hundred, a useless short ball. He's going to close his eyes and thump you when in this form. Pulled to the left of deep backward square leg
short on middle and leg, pulled to deep fine leg. There's no stopping him tonight, is there?
short of a length, opens the face and defends to point
shot! Huge, huge hit. Short, angling in from outside off. That's width and angle: basically, everything you need to do that - a muscular pull over deep square leg
short again, this one gets up more, he controls a pull to deep fine leg
full, wide, driven to point who dives and gets a hand to it to take off the momentum

outside edge for four. And smartly done by the batsman. He took a step towards leg stump to lure the bowler into firing it outside off. But he never actually moved, shuffles towards the line and deliberately plays off the outside edge past the keeper
that's the game. Advances down the track to a full and wide one outside off and flays it through point
